header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 120 of 2019 (Mangesh Katkar etc. 1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000617­2019

background.text: 1) This is the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicant­accused in C.R.No. 18 of 2019 registered with Medha Police Station. 2) Accused were arrested in above mentioned crime on 01.02.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 379 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code. Accused at present are in Magisterial Custody.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 379 r/w 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 3) It is the case of the prosecution that, accused Mangesh Katkar and Sunil Mukane, both have committed theft on 26.01.2019 in the house of complainant Ravindra Shankar Shinde and stolen cash amount of Rs.20,000 and gold ornaments. It is contended that, the place where offence alleged to have committed by the applicants is crowded place, the bail has been rejected by the J.M.F.C. Medha on the ground that, accused belongs to Katari community, having no residential proof etc. Actually, they are falsely implicated in the crime, there is no prima facie evidence against the accused, there is no previous antecedents against the accused applicant, there is five days delay in lodging FIR, families of applicants are depending upon them, hence they prayed for grant of bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3) It is the case of the prosecution that, accused Mangesh Katkar and Sunil Mukane, both have committed theft on 26.01.2019 in the house of complainant Ravindra Shankar Shinde and stolen cash amount of Rs.20,000 and gold ornaments.

It is contended that, the place where offence alleged to have committed by the applicants is crowded place, the bail has been rejected by the J.M.F.C. Medha on the ground that, accused belongs to Katari community, having no residential proof etc.

Actually, they are falsely implicated in the crime, there is no prima facie evidence against the accused, there is no previous antecedents against the accused applicant, there is five days delay in lodging FIR, families of applicants are depending upon them, hence they prayed for grant of bail.

arguments.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5. It is contended that, the investigation is in progress, informant's wife has seen the applicants while they were coming out of his house, applicant no.1 was working in the hotel of informant, applicants have no permanent residential address, applicant no.2 is resident of Mahad, hence, in case of bail, applicants will not attend the police station for investigation and they may abscond.

argumentSentences.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5.

It is contended that, the investigation is in progress, informant's wife has seen the applicants while they were coming out of his house, applicant no.1 was working in the hotel of informant, applicants have no permanent residential address, applicant no.2 is resident of Mahad, hence, in case of bail, applicants will not attend the police station for investigation and they may abscond.

arguments.text: 6) Considering the submissions I have to mention that, accused are in jail since more than one month, admittedly there is no criminal record of the applicants. Already amount is recovered. Learned A.P.P. submitted apprehension of repeating same type of crime, however, conditions may be imposed while granting the bail to attend the Investigating Officer till filing of the charge­sheet. Hence, I proceed to pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: 6) Considering the submissions I have to mention that, accused are in jail since more than one month, admittedly there is no criminal record of the applicants.
Learned A.P.P. submitted apprehension of repeating same type of crime, however, conditions may be imposed while granting the bail to attend the Investigating Officer till filing of the charge­sheet.
Hence, I proceed to pass following order.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 120 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Mangesh Ramchandra Katkar and Sunil Sakharam Mukane be released on bail on their furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each, with one surety each of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall attend Medha Police station on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m to 1.00 p.m. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. d) Compliance before lower Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :5th March, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 120 of 2019 (Mangesh Katkar etc. 1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000617­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This is the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicant­accused in C.R.No. 18 of 2019 registered with Medha Police Station. 2) Accused were arrested in above mentioned crime on 01.02.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 379 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code. Accused at present are in Magisterial Custody. 
---background-ends---
3) It is the case of the prosecution that, accused Mangesh Katkar and Sunil Mukane, both have committed theft on 26.01.2019 in the house of complainant Ravindra Shankar Shinde and stolen cash amount of Rs.20,000 and gold ornaments. It is contended that, the place where offence alleged to have committed by the applicants is crowded place, the bail has been rejected by the J.M.F.C. Medha on the ground that, accused belongs to Katari community, having no residential proof etc. Actually, they are falsely implicated in the crime, there is no prima facie evidence against the accused, there is no previous antecedents against the accused applicant, there is five days delay in lodging FIR, families of applicants are depending upon them, hence they prayed for grant of bail. 
---argument-ends---
3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5. It is contended that, the investigation is in progress, informant's wife has seen the applicants while they were coming out of his house, applicant no.1 was working in the hotel of informant, applicants have no permanent residential address, applicant no.2 is resident of Mahad, hence, in case of bail, applicants will not attend the police station for investigation and they may abscond. 
---argument-ends---
6) Considering the submissions I have to mention that, accused are in jail since more than one month, admittedly there is no criminal record of the applicants. Already amount is recovered. Learned A.P.P. submitted apprehension of repeating same type of crime, however, conditions may be imposed while granting the bail to attend the Investigating Officer till filing of the charge­sheet. Hence, I proceed to pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 120 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Mangesh Ramchandra Katkar and Sunil Sakharam Mukane be released on bail on their furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each, with one surety each of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall attend Medha Police station on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m to 1.00 p.m. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. d) Compliance before lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :5th March, 2019. Satara
